attributes.action: Reduce the amount of time need to qualify for the Royal Fleet Auxiliary (RFA) Long Service Medal,
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The RFA have been supporting the Royal Navy for the last 100 years. Its personnel are expected to spend large amounts of time at sea. Unlike the Royal Navy they are not guaranteed a shore post nor do they retire after 22 years service, often they serve until the age of 65. Yet to qualify for a long service medal they have to serve for at least 20 years, one of the longest amount of service required for a long service medal.

Long service medals for other organisations have the following Criteria

Army/RAF/ Royal Navy Long Service Medal-15 Years required

Volunteer Reserves Service Medal – 10 Years required

Cadet Forces Medal (for Long service) 12-Years Required

Special constabulary medal (for long service)- 9 Years

The amount of years needed to qualify for a RFA long service medal should be reduced.
